case_title: The GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary (Revenue), Board of Revenue, Balochistan, Quetta and 3 others vs Haji SAWAL KHAN and 4 others
appellants: The GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary (Revenue), Board of Revenue, Balochistan, Quetta and 3 others

facts.property_details: 173 acres, 3 rods, and 30 poles in Mauza Arbiseen and Rodleen Tehsil Bori, District Loralai
facts.initial_mutation: Entered in respondents' name during 1966-67 settlement operations
facts.final_mutation: Scored out and entered in appellant's name

legal_proceedings.decision_date: Transferred to Commissioner, Loralai after bifurcation

issues: Section 42 of the Specific Relief Act

appellants: Declaration without possession relief is not maintainable
1964 agreement is invalid as it was not attested
respondents: Reversal of entries violated natural justice
Government does not own the disputed property
Limitation does not apply as possession was continuous

court_findings.cause_of_action: Respondents had cause of action due to possession threats in 1982.
court_findings.limitation: Suit is not time-barred as limitation starts from possession threat.
court_findings.mutation_entries: Reversal of entries violated principles of natural justice.
court_findings.specific_relief_act: Suit for declaration was maintainable as respondents were in possession.
court_findings.government_ownership: Government failed to prove ownership; respondents substantiated their claim with settlement records.

final_decision: Appeal dismissed; parties to bear their own costs.
